file_content.text: Greetings again. I have searched for news of your battles with Darth Angral, but found nothing. I hope your hunt goes well.
When I left Tython, I promised our enemies would fear your name. I'm keeping that vow.
I was in a cantina on Hutta. Some filthy Mandalorians were bragging about how many Jedi they've killed.
I took one's head for a trophy. Told the rest of those scum you were coming for them.
The terror in their faces... I wish you could've seen it. I haven't felt this good in years.
Goodbye, for now....
Greetings, my friend. The HoloNets are filled with stories of your victory on Coruscant.
Everything you achieved on Tython was only a prelude. You are becoming the greatest weapon the Jedi will ever know.
When you executed Darth Angral's son, I hope it was with the lightsaber I taught you to build at the Great Forge.
I remain your most loyal comrade. May the Force be with you.
My comrade... I'd almost lost hope. So much time passed without news from you.
I heard whispers you had died at the Emperor's hands. I shouldn't have believed it. Forgive my lack of faith in you.
I know now that you are alive and defending the Republic against Sith and the weak-willed Jedi who have shown their true natures.
The Republic and Empire have gone to war on Corellia. I hope to see you there.
Victory is at hand. Be strong. May the Force be with us.
I hope this message finds you well. I tried to see you when you were on Tython. The Council kept everyone away.
Now, the temple hallways are filled with rumors. Some say you fell to the dark side and are seeking redemption.
Others say you never fell, that you captured a Sith Lord and are using him to hunt down the Emperor.
I know the truth is probably a lot more complicated. Honestly, all that matters to me is that you're alive.
For a while, everyone assumed you were dead. When I heard that, I felt like I'd lost an old friend.
I'm glad to know that was just a rumor. May the Force be with you. Bengel Morr out....
My comrade... the Jedi are weakening. You and I are the only true warriors among them.
A master and her Padawan tried to capture me. Told me I was sick.
They were so trusting. I tricked them easily. Fed their corpses to a hungry beast. No less than they deserved.
Once you destroy the Empire, we must begin exterminating the weak among our Order. Only the strongest should be Jedi.
Wherever you are now, know that I remain your loyal comrade. Bengel Morr out....
Apologies that I did not contact you sooner. I am far on the Outer Rim, my comrade.
There are secrets and treasures buried here--things that are rightly yours. I will see you have them.
Your victory over Darth Angral has fed the flames of my dedication. My purpose is clear.
You will end the Sith forever. The Emperor himself will fall before you. I've foreseen it.
The Force is with you--with us. Victory is coming....
Hello again. It's Bengel Morr. I hope you'll forgive me for sending another message.
The Masters say talking about my feelings is good. Whether or not you watch these recordings, making them fills me with peace.
I think I prefer talking to you because you saw me at my worst. You understand better than anyone what I became.
I remember the rage I felt when you killed my student, Callef. He was the only true friend I had, back then.
I see now that his death was my fault. I led him to the dark side and forced you to kill him.
That's a hard thing to live with, but I have to try. I owe you that.
Greetings. This is Bengel Morr. The Council permitted me to send you this message. I needed to say some things.
I owe you a debt. No, more than that. I owe you my life.
You saved me. When I think of the dark things I did here on Tython... I fell so far.
My greatest regret is that I never apologized to Master Orgus before he died. He was a good teacher. I miss him.
The Masters tell me I'm making excellent progress. My connection to the light side grows every day.
I hope to repay the gift you've given me, somehow. May the Force be with you.
